channel.title: Home teleport is gone?
channel.description: I'm using deltascape source (cleaned). I go to Action buttons, here I can find all my teleports, all except one(!) and that is my 'home' teleport. It tele's me to falador, but I want to change that to an other location...

item.title: Home teleport is gone?
item.dc:creator: @kampeao kampeao
item.description:
@kampeao wrote:

I fixed my problem, yes,it was that thing, wesley…
I fixed it by myself, but thanks anyway

Read full topic

item.title: Home teleport is gone?
item.dc:creator: @BubbleScape_x BubbleScape x
item.description:
@BubbleScape_x wrote:

[quote=“Shadowspkin, post:12, topic:346622”]Download http://www.mediafire.com/?dnzmydlwmg0 and then click on your teleport once your there do ::mypos then search the first number in the file (by the way put the z-searcher thing in your source files) once you find it go to place you want to be do ::mypos and change the coords ill give you an example code line thow…

c.triggerTele(3088, 3495, 0);

Mine is in clickingMost.Java if you have that :).

Another way someone put’s it (Credits: revengr)

"Use the teleport in th spellbook you want to change, and after you teleport, type ::mypos

Search the first four digit number that you get in your server files.
This is where the z-filesearcher is handy.

There should be a couple teleports that are the same.
Change them all to your new home location.

They either look like this…

ToX: #### ToY: ####

Or this…

triggerTele(####, ####, #)

The third number in triggerTele should be a 0 "[/quote]No need for this all. He fixed the problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Home teleport is gone?
item.dc:creator: @Shadowspkin Shadowspkin
item.description:
@Shadowspkin wrote:

Download http://www.mediafire.com/?dnzmydlwmg0 and then click on your teleport once your there do ::mypos then search the first number in the file (by the way put the z-searcher thing in your source files) once you find it go to place you want to be do ::mypos and change the coords ill give you an example code line thow…

c.triggerTele(3088, 3495, 0);

Mine is in clickingMost.Java if you have that :).

Another way someone put’s it (Credits: revengr)

"Use the teleport in th spellbook you want to change, and after you teleport, type ::mypos

Search the first four digit number that you get in your server files.
This is where the z-filesearcher is handy.

There should be a couple teleports that are the same.
Change them all to your new home location.

They either look like this…

ToX: #### ToY: ####

Or this…

triggerTele(####, ####, #)

The third number in triggerTele should be a 0 "

Read full topic

item.title: Home teleport is gone?
item.dc:creator: @w-e_s-l_e-y w-e_s-l_e-y@hotmail.com
item.description:
@w-e_s-l_e-y wrote:

well the soution was to find this:

case 50235: c.triggerTele(xxxx + Misc.random(3), xxxx + Misc.random(3), 0);

and change the both xxxx to your coordinates of your choice

Read full topic

item.title: Home teleport is gone?
item.dc:creator: @kampeao kampeao
item.description:
@kampeao wrote:

Next time you solve a problem,tell us what the solution was!
I’m with the same problem…i want to find the target of that teleport…
I can’t find the coordinates.

Read full topic

item.title: Home teleport is gone?
item.dc:creator: @BubbleScape_x BubbleScape x
item.description:
@BubbleScape_x wrote:

[quote=“w-e_s-l_e-y@hotmail.com, post:7, topic:346622”]I’ve looked at the clickingmost.java file, I can find all other tele’s like, pk tele, monster tele etc.

But I can’t find the home tele anywhere, I can’t search for the coordinates of it because it is +misc.random (x)

x = something I don’t know yet because I can’t find it…[/quote]LOOK AT CLIENT.JAVA -.-

Read full topic

item.title: Home teleport is gone?
item.dc:creator: @BubbleScape_x BubbleScape x
item.description:
@BubbleScape_x wrote:

[quote=“jmood128, post:5, topic:346622”][quote author=BubbleScape x link=topic=443001.msg3253114#msg3253114 date=1277921938]

Search in your action button.java and search for the falador coordinates.
[/quote]Wrong. The teleports to places, are found in client.java for most sources.

Deltascape is not like most sources, it has a different class to handle the clicking most packet. So I would suggest looking in their and then the client class.[/quote]Okay sorry, I hope not to get into a fight with you, if you say my tutorial pack is aweshum D:<

Read full topic

item.title: Home teleport is gone?
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“BubbleScape x, post:4, topic:346622”][quote author=jmood128 link=topic=443001.msg3253113#msg3253113 date=1277921893]
Search in your action button.java and search for the falador coordinates.
[/quote]Wrong. The teleports to places, are found in client.java for most sources.[/quote]

Deltascape is not like most sources, it has a different class to handle the clicking most packet. So I would suggest looking in their and then the client class.

Read full topic
